byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by James Kanter from Brussels, Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, and Michael R. Gordon and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan says peace process with Kurdish militants is impossible, leading some to question whether government is more focused on suppressing Kurds rather than fighting Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has ramped up tensions with Kurdish militants, saying he cannot continue a two-year-old peace process with them.

headline.main: Turkey’s Focus on Crushing Kurdish Separatists Complicates the Fight Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Turkey’s Focus on Crushing Kurd Extremists Complicates ISIS Efforts

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has ramped up tensions with Kurdish militants, saying he cannot continue a two-year-old peace process with them.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
